info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 5:47PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...A frontal boundary with scattered thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Pondera, northwestern Meagher, western Judith Basin, southwestern Liberty, southern Toole, eastern Teton, southwestern Chouteau and Cascade Counties through 630 PM MDT... At 545 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a frontal boundary along a line extending from 12 miles west of Brady to near Great Falls to 19 miles north of White Sulphur Springs. Movement was east at 25 mph. Scattered thunderstorms were along and up to 20 miles either side of the boundary HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Great Falls, Choteau, Fairfield, Belt, Dutton, Fort Shaw, Brady, The Knees, Highwood, Black Eagle, Geyser, Fort Shaw, Power, Carter, Neihart, Floweree, Eden, Sapphire Village, Stockett and First Peoples Buffalo Jump State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
